data.title: Amazing crepes but no where to sit
data.text: Flavors abound here. Just about anything you can think of in the way of sweet and savory crepes. Very good but not super feeling I definitely suggest getting a large one and not a mini. The minis would be good for kids. We paid and then the girl told us there was no eggs which was kind of a bummer but it still tasted good. The other one we got was a strawberry lemon curd cream cheese one and it was fabulous.

data.title: Average crepes and no where to stand
data.text: I am a breakfast guy. You wouldn't know it by looking at me (what does a breakfast guy look like?). I have had breakfast all over the USA. And I'll eat it any time - day or night. These crepes were okay, but I hated that I had to leave. Not just the shop but the whole area. There is no where to sit and eat. Oh, and don't ask for a beverage to enjoy with the meal...

data.title: Good but over rated
data.text: Just happened to drive this place one time and the line to get inside was ridiculous, so I kept it in mind. When I finally did go to eat, the line wasn't too bad but it was also in the middle of the day. There are no places to eat inside, and their menu is written on the wall. Your choices can be on the dessert side (sweet) or you can choose to make a meal out of it. Many choices to choose from, all a bit over priced but the girl who took our order was nice, and even recommended some things since it was our first time. Took awhile to receive our food, so don't visit if you are in a hurry. This place is only a few hundred feet away from A La Minute, and easy to find. If I ever get a craving for crepes, I might return.

data.title: Delicious and Kinda Addictive
data.text: My family used to enjoy fresh crepes on occasional visits to Victoria Garden's but now we've got a great local option in Redlands.  We were happy to see the Crepes of Wrath setup shop downtown in a great location.  We've enjoyed many an afternoon and late evening crepe since.  They have a list of good, fresh ingredients that you can order in any combination for a "sweet" or "savory" crepe.  I confess that we've only tried the sweet variety, though I've seen many tempting savory options and keep meaning to try one.  My favorite is peanut butter, banana, and honey (that's pretty healthy, right?). My wife likes the blueberry batter with fresh blueberries and sweet cream.  The kid's like the always popular Nutella and banana.  If you haven't had a fresh crepe recently, check it out and design your favorite!

data.title: Tasty and different!
data.text: Tasty crepes which we picked up to eat while waiting for show at the Redlands Bowl.  This place is hard to spot from the street.  No place to sit, but there is a counter on the sidewalk to stand and eat if you want.

data.title: Crepes of Yum!
data.text: While I think this place is definitely a "locals place" to go because of its location it's worth a stop in if you are passing through. For those of us allergic wheat/gluten rest assured they have a gluten free batter which is delicious! We all got dessert crepes and in one they put an entire banana! So good! I will be trying a savory one next time with steak yum! This is a walk up only place with a counter out front to stand and eat your treats so not an ideal date place but you can get it to go or walk down a bit and sit on a bench.

data.title: Gluten-free crepes available!
data.text: Both sweet and savory options. Fresh ingredients. Fun to watch. Good for a date or just hanging out with friends.

data.title: Good portion size and great taste, but soggy crepe
data.text:
Cute little eatery with standing room to eat outside only.

I suppose it depends on personal preference, but I found my crepe to be too soggy for a 5 star rating. Ordered the caprese (included chicken so yum) - it was a very good size, the food came out fast and the flavor was certainly there, however the crepe itself had no crispness to it and was very soggy even though I started eating it within 3 minutes of purchase.

Overall, glad they have a new eatery in town and I will probably return to try the dessert crepes (hopefully those are crispy so I can rewrite my review).

Dessert Crepes are $7
Savory Crepes are $9

data.title: A large helping
data.text:
the food is most fab!
it is a whole meal in itself, you could share the amount they give you. so the value is great.
the Crepes are extremely tasty, abd you can watch them make it, which is fun for kids.
The only drawback is, there is no place to sit.
The Nutella crepe is most delicious.

data.title: Great crepes
data.text: The crepes are awesome, they have huge servings, and they are delicious. However, the storefront is super tiny and there is no place to sit. There's a standing bar outside although it's in direct sunlight all day long making it miserable for about half of the year.I recommend buying your crêpe, then walking around the corner to a shaded bench on the main street.

data.title: Unique and Delicious
data.text: We were walking around an art festival in Redlands and saw this little crepe shop. There is no seating but you can watch your crepe being made. The menu is simple, sweet or savory with your choice of regular or whole grain or gluten free. The savory crepes are stuffed full enough to satisfy any hunger and the sweet crepes are a delicious treat in the middle of the afternoon. I wish they had a shop like this in more cities around SoCal.

data.title: Wow super good.
data.text: If you love crapes you gotta eat here. Sweet or savory you can put whatever you want on your crepe for a very good price. This is not a sit down restaurant. It is a street front shop. It was very busy yet quite fast. We went back the next day for seconds. Cant wait for our next visit in June!

data.title: EAT THE CREPE!
data.text:
You want a crepe. You do. You just don't know it yet.   You want rich and fresh ingredients in a fresh cooked wrap right in front of you, but you just don't know it yet.  You've been drinking at one of the many bars in downtown redlands and you need something in your system to absorb all that alcohol, so get a crepe.   You'll love crepes whether you're sober or not so sober.  There are not the skinny anorexic meager crepes you'd get from some pseudo-hipster crepe shop in LA, these are big strong heavy crepes.  You will be full after having one of these crepes, and you will be happy because you tried a good quality food with fresh ingredients. Eat the Crepe!
There is 'outdoor seating' however it consists of a stand up bar next to the crepe cafe, so 'seating' isn't the apt word.

data.title: Unique and very good!
data.text: My grandson and his girlfriend went here and really liked it, and later I was shopping with my grandson's girlfriend so we went there for lunch. The food is very good and they have so many different fillings that you can choose from. There are sweet dessert crepes and other fillings like vegetables, eggs, meat, cheese, etc. It's very different than anyplace I have been and I enjoyed the food very much. It's also interesting to watch them make the crepes. I would definitely recommend trying it.
